objects.name: TutorialText
objects.string: You play the game as an alchemist, trying to achieve what no one else before you could - creating the Phylosopher's stone. You will have to answer questions about chemical reactions, to get the substances involved in them. Then you will have to connect all of your materials in one space to create the Phylosopher's stone. The game should be easy to learn as you play, after all.

objects.name: QuestionH2O
objects.string: Which of these is a correct chemical reaction, where one product of the reaction water?

objects.name: HgQuestionWindow
objects.string: In which one of these reactions, is one product of the reaction mercury?

objects.name: QuestionTextP
objects.string: In which one of these reactions, is one product of the reaction sulphur?

objects.name: CsClQuestionBox
objects.string: In which one of these reactions, is one product of the reaction caesium chlorine?

objects.name: FinalText
objects.string: You now have possesion of the six elements needed to create the Phylosopher's stone - Water, Mercury, Sulfur, Caesium Chloride, and some leaves and stone you found on the ground. This will enable you to complete alchemy's biggest challange. Drag the elements onto the middle of the grey circle of reactions. Once all six of them are on the gray part on top of each other, the quest is complete.

objects.name: WinText
objects.string:
This is it. You've done it! Through knowledge and experiments, you have achieved alchemy's greatest goal! You've created the phylosophers stone, able to cure any desease, and do a bunch of other stuff. You are now history's greatest alchemist.
Click the button on bottom right, to go back to the start screen
